head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: former world top-ranking amateur and professional tennis player

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: won the Pro Grand Slam in 1963

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: won 9 slams in doubles with a career double grand slam

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: considered to be one of the greatest tennis players of all time

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: enjoyed a long career at the highest levels from the early 1950s to the early 1970s

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: one of the two best male players for about nine years

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: World No. 1 player for a number of years in the early 1960s

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: ranked among the top 20 players, amateur or professional, every year from 1952 through 1977

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: only player to have simultaneously held Pro Grand Slam titles on three different surfaces (1962–1963)

head: Kenneth Robert Rosewall
tail: 1971 Australian Open he became the first male player during the open era to win a Grand Slam tournament without dropping a set
